rationales.achievement: Stayed until 7pm revising slides after mentor's feedback about 'tighter pacing' - investing extra effort to meet standards of excellence.
rationales.hedonism: Said yes to Korean BBQ but 'already thinking about how much marking I need to clear' - sacrificing mental presence in leisure for work concerns.
rationales.benevolence: Prioritizing work preparation over quality time with Arjun, already mentally absent from weekend plans.

rationales.achievement: Still cutting laminated shapes at 6:30pm while others leave at 5pm - investing extra effort for student engagement. Cares that Aisha says 'math is her favorite subject now.'
rationales.conformity: Response deflects criticism by deferring to authority: 'she's been teaching for 20 years and has seen a hundred new teachers' - accepting mentor's judgment rather than defending her approach.

rationales.achievement: Insisted on writing personalized comments for all 32 students instead of using template phrases - pursuing quality and recognition ('Mrs. Tan actually complimented my reports').
rationales.hedonism: Cancelled Christmas market, cousin's birthday dinner, and spa day with friends - 'third thing I've cancelled this month' - sacrificing enjoyment for work.
rationales.benevolence: Repeatedly letting down Arjun ('I could hear the disappointment'), friends, and family despite knowing the cost to relationships.

rationales.stimulation: Spontaneous night market visit, buying 'ridiculous matching couple keychains', planning trip to Malacca for chicken rice ball - embracing novelty and spontaneity.
rationales.hedonism: Spent an hour on the garden swing 'just reading a novel. An actual novel, not a teaching resource.' Enjoying food, leisure, being present without work intrusion.
rationales.benevolence: Quality time with Arjun's family - 'watched a movie, played cards with his grandma' - investing in close relationships and enjoying family connection.

rationales.self_direction: Made autonomous decision to close laptop and wait until tomorrow despite anxiety telling her 'other teachers are already preparing' - choosing own path over external pressure.
rationales.hedonism: Deliberately choosing to 'protect this feeling a little longer' - prioritizing present enjoyment and quality of life over productivity.
rationales.achievement: Actively resisting urge to check email and prepare, explicitly rejecting the voice saying she'll 'be behind' - deprioritizing achievement metrics.

rationales.self_direction: Said 'senior teacher track because that's what you're supposed to say' rather than expressing authentic doubts - surrendering decision-making to external expectations.
rationales.achievement: Discussing MOE promotion framework, comparing self to friend Meilin who's 'already coordinating' programs - engaged with career progression metrics despite ambivalence.
rationales.conformity: Feeling pressure from parents asking about 'career progression', in-laws proud of 'professional jobs', mentor pushing success by her definition - conforming to multiple authorities' expectations.
rationales.benevolence: Values Dinesh 'finally starting to participate in class' more than 'being on some committee' - prioritizing student welfare over personal advancement.

rationales.self_direction: Affirming authentic values: 'Moments like this are why I teach. Not for reviews or promotions... it's the truest thing I know about myself' - defining own meaning of success.
rationales.benevolence: Pulled Aisha aside to praise her story, told her mom about it - investing time in nurturing a student's discovered talent, 'a 9-year-old discovering she can create something beautiful.'

rationales.achievement: Response reveals measuring against internalized standards: 'the version of myself I thought I'd be by now' - an 'effortlessly great teacher' who has it all together.
rationales.hedonism: Brunch was 'supposed to be relaxing but I couldn't stop calculating how many hours until Monday' - unable to enjoy leisure, sacrificing present pleasure for work anxiety.
